title: Minimalism: Less Is the Whole Point
description: A quick, practical guide to Minimalism: Less Is the Whole Point.

hook.text: Donald Judd stacked identical metal boxes on a wall. He called them art. Many people disagreed.

buildup.text: Minimalism stripped art to its essentials: shape, color, material. No symbolism, no narrative.

discovery.text: The idea: the artwork is just the object itself. Don't look for hidden meaning â€” just experience it.

twist.text: Minimalism looked simple but was conceptually radical â€” it rejected 500 years of artistic expression.

climax.text: Its influence shaped modern architecture, tech design, and the entire aesthetic of Silicon Valley.

punchline.text: They removed everything. What remained was enough.

quiz.question: What did Minimalist artists want viewers to do?
